results.title: Calypso Summer
results.creator_credit: Lincoln Tyner and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: In the summer of 1960-61 a team of cricketers from the West Indies visited Australia. The came as underdogs, and although Australia won the series of Tests, they left the country as one of the most loved sporting teams ever to visit Australia. This video is an informative mixture of archival footage, humourous anecdotes and poignant reflections by surviving players from the Test series, one that has become the benchmark against which all great Test series are judged and compared. Narrated by Michael Habib.

results.title: Buried alive, the story of East Timor
results.creator_credit: Rod Hibberd, Fabio Cavadini and Gil Scrine
results.brief_description: In this film we see why the East Timor question is too important to go away. “The Story of East Timor” begins in a neglected corner of the Portuguese colonial empire. In Lisbon, the unexpected fall of the dictatorship projects the people of East Timor into world politics. It is to be a terrible experience. “Buried Alive” exposes some of the ugly truths about the nature of Western democracy, the world media and Third World Colonialism. Rated: PG

results.title: Calling the shots: the advertising of alcohol
results.creator_credit: Jean Kilbourne and Cambridge Documentary Films
results.brief_description: Based on the research of Jean Kilbourne, media analyst, this film examines images used by advertisers to sell alcohol. This detailed analysis shows how some advertising attracts young people to drink, but also disguises issues like alcohol abuse Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Calle 54
results.creator_credit: Fernando Trueba, Fabienne Servan-Schreiber, Cristina Huete, Tequila Gang, Fernando Trueba P.C., Fandango and Cineteve
results.brief_description: Director Fernando Trueba (Belle Epoque) displays his love of Latin jazz in this documentary that showcases the talents of numerous musicians by inviting them to perform in a New York City studio. Preceding each performance is a brief introduction by Trueba addressing the artists’ diverse backgrounds. Aside from these moments however, “Calle 54” fails to expand upon the potentially interesting stories behind the talent, resulting in what is essentially a performance piece celebrating Latin jazz and all its variations. Highlights include Chano Dominguez displaying his flair for merging flamenco and jazz; Cuban pianist Chucho Valdes (son of Bebe) playing a powerful solo; legendary percussionist Tito Puente and horn player Paquito D’Rivera in full swing; barefoot Brazilian Eliane Elias on piano; and the New York-based Jerry Gonzalez wigging out. Other musicians featured are Gato Barbieri, Cachao, Michel Camilo, Eliane Elias, Chico O’Farrill, Orlando ‘Puntilla’ Rios and Carlos ‘Patato’ Valdes. Also features some thrilling flamenco dancing and singing.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Fernando Trueba, Fabienne Servan-Schreiber, Cristina Huete, Tequila Gang, Fernando Trueba P.C., Fandango and Cineteve

results.title: Call to protect English football players from racism
results.brief_description: Following England’s defeat by Italy during a penalty shoot-out in the European soccer championship, black players from the English team who missed their shots were bombarded with racist abuse on social media – from English fans. Fans and supporters like @_etherealtruth responded with a plea to protect the players and black Britons – who will continue to feel the effects of the racist backlash – asking “Only British when it suits you, right?”
results.title_for_label: Call to protect English football players from racism
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

Following England’s defeat by Italy during a penalty shoot-out in the European soccer championship, black players from the English team who missed their shots were bombarded with racist abuse on social media – from English fans. Supporters like @_etherealtruth responded with a plea to protect the players and black Britons – who will continue to feel the effects of the racist backlash – asking “Only British when it suits you, right?”

Throughout the tournament, the English football team ‘took the knee’ at the beginning of matches to highlight racial discrimination, injustice and inequality, a gesture that originated with former American footballer and civil rights activist Colin Kaepernick, who in 2016 knelt during the national anthem to protest police brutality and racial inequality in the United States. Considering the anti-racist gesture the team made during the tournament, for players Jadon Sancho, Marcus Rashford and Bukayo Saka to be targeted by trolls left many across the country deeply disappointed, with condemnation coming swiftly from Prime Minister Boris Johnston, Prince William and England’s governing football association, as well as activists, fans and supporters.
description_for_label:
This responsive display presents the moments capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

Following England’s defeat by Italy during a penalty shoot-out in the European soccer championship, black players from the English team who missed their shots were bombarded with racist abuse on social media – from English fans. Supporters like @_etherealtruth responded with a plea to protect the players and black Britons – who will continue to feel the effects of the racist backlash – asking “Only British when it suits you, right?”

results.title: Burden of dreams
results.brief_description: A documentary by Les Blank which provides a detailed look at the making of the ill-starred five year production of Werner Herzog’s feature film ‘Fitzcarraldo’. Set in the jungle of Peru ‘Fitzcarraldo’ is the story of an opera mad genius (played by Klaus Kinski) who will stop at nothing to achieve his ideal of building an opera house in the middle of the jungle. In many ways the narrative of Fitzcarraldo parallels Herzog’s production experiences. Despite one setback after another in filming: from monsoonal floods to warring native tribespeople, Herzog persisted with his dream until the film was complete. Not a conventional ‘behind-the-scenes’ promotional documentary, but a film which raises the question about the pursuit of art and what it can entail.

results.title: Call of the wild
results.creator_credit: Ken Annakin, Arthur Brauner, Harry Allen Towers, Towers of London (Films), Universal Pictures France, Oceania Produzioni Internazionali Cinematografiche, Izaro Films, CCC Filmkunst and Massfilms
results.brief_description: One of a plethora of adaptations for the big and small screen of Jack London’s famous novel, this 1972 film version of “Call of the wild” features Charlton Heston as Jack Thornton, a kindly would-be prospector heading for the 1897 Klondike gold rush, who adopts a mistreated dog. The man and the animal strike up a unique friendship as they travel through the wilderness. This family orientated film was a multi-national production filmed on location in Norway. The voices of non-English speaking actors were dubbed into English. Cast also includes Michele Mercier, George Eastman and Maria Rohm.

results.title: Call of the wild
results.creator_credit: Peter Svatek, Julie Allan, Pieter Kroonenburg, Kingsborough Greenlight Pictures, Fries/Schultz Film Group and Hallmark Entertainment
results.brief_description: Based on Jack London’s classic novel about an Alaskan gold prospector and the dog he saves from a brutal life of slavery as a sled dog in Canada’s vast frozen Yukon territory. This French/Canadian co-production has been hailed as one of the most accurate dramatic presentations of London’s work. Cast includes Rutger Hauer, Burke Lawrence, Charles Powell, Bronwen Booth and Richard Dreyfuss

results.title: Call it murder = Midnight
results.brief_description: A decision (and ensuing conviction that all murderers are subject to capital punishment) to sentence a woman to death for a crime of passion comes back to haunt jury foreman Edward Weldon (O.P. Heggie), when he has a personal stake in a capital punishment trial. Weldon’s daughter, Stella (Sidney Fox) kills a former lover who betrayed her, challenging her father’s assumption that all murderers deserve the ultimate punishment, and all on the eve of the execution of the woman he helped sway the jury to send to the electric chair. Humphrey Bogart plays a brief but memorable role as one of the murder victims. Cast also includes Granville Bates and Helen Flint.

results.title: California suite
results.creator_credit: Herbert Ross, Ray Stark and Columbia Films
results.brief_description: Five couples find themselves in a Beverley Hills hotel during the week of the Oscars. Four stories blend with an all star cast and the slick writing style of Neil Simon, to produce a comedy about human behaviour in all its variety. Maggie Smith won the Oscar for this 1970’s comedy which made the transition from the New York Stage to the big screen. Also stars: Jane Fonda, Alan Alda, Michael Caine, Walter Matthau, Elaine May, Herb Edelman, Denise Galik, Richard Pryor, Bill Cosby, Gloria Gifford and Sheila Frazier.
